column8: Answer3 Text
Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)

column2: 2. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: The car on your right.

column2: 3. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 4. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.

column2: 5. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column8: All of the above.

column2: 6. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column8: All of the above.

column4: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column8: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
a side road.
Railroad Crossing
Right lane ends

column2: 11. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 12. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
Hill or downgrade up ahead

column2: 14. An Instructional Permit allows you to:
column4: operate a motor vehicle when supervised by another driver over age of 21.
column6: operate a motor vehicle without supervision.
column8: sit in the front seat when another driver operates a motor vehicle.
Anti-Locking Brake System

column4: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: The road will curve to the right.
sharp turn

column2: 18. When taking medication while driving, you should:
column4: consult your physicians and/or pharmacist regarding any prescription medication and its possible effects on driving.
column8: drive 20 MPH below the posted speed limit.

column2: 19. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: must turn into its left lane.

column4: slow down and check your left mirror.
column6: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.
Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 22. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.

column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: guide drivers.

column2: 24. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column6: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
column8: help create a safe driving environment.

column2: 25. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.
